definition: Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: Xiao Qian's novels of religious topic are highty concerned in the literary history.
sentences.chinese: 蕭乾的宗教題材小說在文學史上是備受關注的。

sentences.english: This article probes the relationship between Xiao Qian's novels and the poetic nature.
sentences.chinese: 蕭乾小說具有明顯的詩性特徵。

sentences.english: The first part of the dissertation discusses the form of Xiao Qian's concept of novel creation.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分着重探討蕭乾的小說創作理念的嬗變。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Liu Binyan (1925-2005), journalist and novelist, condemned by Mao as rightist faction in 1957, subsequently dissident writer
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
